ovdesc.p: This application EB.CASHFLOW.CAPTURE will take care of updating EB.CASHFLOW capture for existing contracts in the system.

This application will update the EB.CASHFLOW initially and link the contract to update the cash flow and thereafter by updating the fields IAS.CLASSIFICATION and IFRS.SUB.TYPE. On running the service BNK/IFRS.CAPTURE.SERVICE, the EB.CASHFLOW.CAPTURE record will be converted to EB.CASHFLOW record.

desc.p: This field denotes the IAS.CLASSIFICATION id.
Mandatory field.
This field will store the effective rate of interest of the contract.
Either AMC or EIR must be inputted but not both.
This field will be a signed amount from the point of view of the bank. For example a loan disbursement will be a negative amount and a repayment will be a positive amount.
Will be updated by system only if the field POPULATE.CASHFLOW is set as "YES"
This field denotes any error that occurs during the service IFRS.CAPTURE.SERVICE.
This field denotes the cash flows which are not considered for EIR calculation or for any IFRS related calculations.
The cash flows which are marked EXLD.FROM.EIR are only for informative purpose.
Will be updated by system only if the field POPULATE.CASHFLOW is set as "YES"
This field denotes the date from which the new rate, in case of a rate fixing contract, will be applicable.
This field denotes the INTEREST.BASIS of the underlying contract.
No input field.
Will be updated by system only if the field POPULATE.CASHFLOW is set as "YES"
This field denotes the market rate for the contract.
This can either be a ID in PERIODIC.INTEREST table or the actual rate itself.
If this field POPULATE.CASHFLOW is set as ‘YES’, system will get the static, rate and cash flow information and will populate it to EB.CASHFLOW.CAPTURE.
If this field POPULATE.CASHFLOW is set as ‘N’, system expects the user to provide the cash flow information as well as the rate and static information.
This field denotes the contract currency.
No input field.
Will be updated by system only if the field POPULATE.CASHFLOW is set as "YES"
This field denotes the key to IFRS.SUB.TYPE file.
Mandatory field.
This field denotes the Rate of the underlying contract.
No input field.
Will be updated by system only if the field POPULATE.CASHFLOW is set as "YES"
This field denotes the outstanding amount to the bank as on the rate fix date.
This field hold the asset type like AMORTISED, FAIRVALUE or DISCLOSURE.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
This field denotes the Amortised cost amount used for the calculation of EIR.
If AMC Balance is inputted then with that and all the future cash flows for the contract, the system will calculate the EIR.
Either AMC or EIR must be inputted but not both.
The id of EB.CASHFLOW.CAPTURE contains two components.
The first component is the application name.
The second components is the key to the record in the application.
Both these components are separated by '*'
Example:
LD.LOANS.AND.DEPOSITS*LD0033500001
This field denotes the date of the cash flow.
Will be updated by system only if the field POPULATE.CASHFLOW is set as "YES"
This field denotes the OPERAND which will be used along with MARKET.MARGIN.
Example: +/-

Flexibility is given to the user through the field MARKET.MARGIN to include margin as a percentage of the market rate in to the calculation of the fair value. Both positive and negative margin percentage can be inputted.

For example if the market rate is 10%. With the positive margin of +0.50%, the net rate for the calculation will be 10.50% and with a negative margin of -0.50%, the net rate for the calculation will be 9.50%.
This is a multi valued field. Standard T24 alphanumeric field.
A maximum of 35 characters may be entered.
This is a multi valued field.
Contains details of any override applicable to this record.
A maximum of 35 characters may be entered. This is a NOINPUT field.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
